info.author: Kelvin DeCosta
info.description:
# Vocabulum

A utility that improves your vocabulary.

## Installation

```bash
pip install vocabulum
```

## Usage

```bash
vocab -h
```

```
usage: vocab [-h] {define,pick} ...

Vocabulary Tool

positional arguments:
  {define,pick}
    define       define a word
    pick         pick a word at random

optional arguments:
  -h, --help     show this help message and exit
```

#### `define`

Display the definition of a word.

```bash
vocab define vocabulary
```

```
vocabulary

    pronunciation     /və(ʊ)ˈkabjʊləri/
    origin            Mid 16th century (denoting a list of words with definitions or translations): from medieval Latin vocabularius, from Latin vocabulum (see vocable).

    meaning

        noun

            The body of words used in a particular language.
            a comparison of the vocabularies of different languages
            lexicon, word stock, lexis

            A range of artistic or stylistic forms, techniques, or movements.
            dance companies have their own vocabularies of movement
```

> If the word is not in the local dictionary, the program queries Google using an unofficial API.
> It then stores the word in the local dictionary.

#### `pick`

Pick a random word from the local dictionary.

Specify a `prefix` to limit the search to a group of words.

```bash
vocab pick -p vocab
```

```
vocabulary

    pronunciation     /və(ʊ)ˈkabjʊləri/
    origin            Mid 16th century (denoting a list of words with definitions or translations): from medieval Latin vocabularius, from Latin vocabulum (see vocable).

    meaning

        noun

            The body of words used in a particular language.
            a comparison of the vocabularies of different languages
            lexicon, word stock, lexis

            A range of artistic or stylistic forms, techniques, or movements.
            dance companies have their own vocabularies of movement
```
